title: What Is Lane Taxing?
body:
Lane or minion taxing is when the jungler takes some cs from lane as payment for his services. If you're not aware, the gold earned from jungling is lower than lanes. So if the jungler takes time out of his jungling to come to your lane, then collecting tax is necessary to make up for the lost potential income.

Some examples of taxable services:
Ganking which results in a kill or sends opponent back to base.
Holding your lane because you died or needed to recall.
Holding your lane because you decided to roam.

Some examples of services we don't tax:
Ganking which doesn't kill or send opponent back to base.
Giving you blue or red buff.
Warding around your lane.

So next time your jungler comes to help you out, show some love and pay your taxes.

~ Na Boards

replies.body: Also, if they burn summs, even if there is not a kill involved or they just retreat to tower i ussually give them a minion or two.

Also not really taxing but when you get a kill on the enemy laner unless you have the intention or have the position to freeze the current wave always push it out and if possible to take tower let your jungler proxy farm the wave under enemy turret ( I thought you were asking a question about lane taxing xD )
As lee sin I always push the wave if my laner and the enemy laner has similar cs

> [{quoted}](name=iAkeno,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=1xgyNlit,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2016-07-26T07:28:38.735+0000)
>
> As lee sin I always push the wave if my laner and the enemy laner has similar cs

Yeah i know JG means well, but sometimes you can push a turret way too early for some champs, like Malz really likes mid frozen till around 12mins into game. Even if mid died twice and your JG can safely push with you... Personally i'd rather it not, it creates to deep a pocket of doom for me.... think about how unprotected middle is without both enemy and your turret up and being there for the objectives. Had way too many games where i've dominated (well 2-3 kills) and pushed turret quickly, only to find my map positioning really sucks and i dont want to spend too much time roaming compared to downing waves and getting farm up.

Much <3 for unerstanding both sides of the fence iAkeno
You really made good points there and I would ensure to apply this to my next jungle gameplay.
Freaking GST. Stupid Turnbull. I never used to have this much lane tax in any of my games....
Soon we would be taking 30 minions per gank muhahahaha >:D
Summoners also come at 2 casters a piece :P
Order now! 50% discount ( offer ends tomorrow)

IMO, this is frequent when i get asked to come help, and as i come in to gank, they dont need me, i dont even get a freaking assist, so im all for this, i do take 2-3minions (roughly 100g or so) as payment for my time out from farming, otherwise ill stick to a strict jg path so i have 1100g at 5min30sec, and level 6 at 7mins, and generally full JG item shortly after / next back.

The only lane that really has a right to complain, is a struggling ADC who is being zoned/constantly harassed from any farm, ive seen games where a JG has decimated the champ, taken entire wave and the adc has close to 1/2 the enemy adc's farm, and barely a kill/assist.

Taxing in those situations, is not cool. Even if you think you'll be the carry and win the game, don't force your struggling teammate to be an orange peeler for your glory.
I don't tax if my laner is like at least 20 cs behind
